SafetyInspectionBy: Iowa Department of Agriculture & Land Stewardship

_prev_prog_3.MH_OtherType: Vehicle or Projectile Strike, Vandalism, Theft, or Terrorism

_emerg_resp.FR_OtherRegulation: This is a non-responding facility and it coordinates its response activities with the LEPC and local Fire Department. Notification information and procedures are provided in its Contingency Plan.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Helena Agri-Enterprises, LLC (HAE) is submitting this electronic RMP in compliance with the provisions of the Clean Air Act § 112(r) as codified by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) at 29 CFR § 1910.119 and by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) at 40 CFR §68.  The OSHA PSM and EPA Subpart D RMP standards are applicable to operations at this Facility.  This electronic RMP summarizes the policies and procedures implemented by the Facility to minimize the likelihood of an accident, and to ensure that a response to a release will be implemented in a proper and timely manner.

PURPOSE FOR UPDATING RMP

HAE is resubmitting the Facility EPA registration to reflect the equipment changes that have been made at the facility.  All accident prevention elements have been developed and reviewed.

FACILITY

The operations at this Facility consist of agricultural chemical storage and handling, blending, retail sale and distribution.  The covered processes operated at this Facility include:

o	Covered Process 1: Fertilizer Blending (Ammonium Polyphosphate)

The Facility coordinates delivery of anhydrous ammonia by Cargo Truck and hires a Contactor (A.K.A. Independent Fertilizer Reacting Contractor  IFRC) to transfer and blend anhydrous ammonia with super phosphoric acid and water to make ammonium polyphosphate (APP) fertilizer.  The APP liquid fertilizer is blended in a Mobile Pipe Reactor (MPR) that is owned and operated by the Contractor.  The APP liquid fertilizer is not subject to the PSM/RMP rules.
The Cargo Truck Owner/Operator is responsible for: transporting anhydrous ammonia to the Facility and staging the Cargo Truck.  The Cargo Truck remains connected to the mode of transportation (i.e. Tractor/Truck) and is considered to be in a status of incident to transportation.  The IFRC Contractor is responsible for: coordinating responsibilities with the Cargo Truck Operator; connecting the Cargo Truck to the MPR; opening va

lves and transferring anhydrous ammonia from the Cargo Truck to the MPR; blending the APP liquid fertilizer; closing the valves and disconnecting from the Cargo Truck; and releasing the Cargo Truck back to the Cargo Truck owner/operator.  

ACCIDENT PREVENTION PROGRAM

The Warehouse Manager implements the risk management planning process at this Facility. The Warehouse Manager is assisted by other trained personnel as directed. The Warehouse Manager is responsible for ensuring that its employees are properly trained in the implementation of the Program 3 Accident Prevention Program elements as related to their responsibilities.  The accident prevention program elements addressed in the PSM/RMP combined program includes: Management System, Employee Participation, Process Safety Information, Process Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, Training, Contractor, Pre-Startup Review, Mechanical Integrity, Hot Work Permit, Management of Change, Incident Investigation, Emergency Response, Compliance Audits, and Trade Secrets.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

This is a non-responding Facility. The Facility has coordinated emergency response activities with its local emergency response agency and local fire department. 

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no on-site deaths, injuries, or significant property damage; or off-site deaths, injuries, property damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place, in the past five (5) years because of the ammonia Warehouse at this Facility.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Planned changes to improve safety at this Facility includes: 
	Document annual coordination with response agencies.
	Document annual notification exercise.
	Update the Facility PSM/RMP program to reflect the EPA RMP rule changes published on May 2024.
